summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP Captain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, manipulative behavior, the July 23, 2019 incident, and the failures in protocol on the night of August 9-10, 2019, including missing cellmates and non-completion of rounds and counts.

persons.name: Amanda Meyer
persons.context: One of the interviewing agents who conducted the voluntary interview with the BOP Captain.

persons.name: David Carpenter
persons.context: One of the interviewing agents from the Office of the Inspector General who conducted the interview with the BOP Captain.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate who died at MCC. The interview details his housing, manipulative behavior to avoid cellmates, a prior incident, and the circumstances of his death.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found unresponsive. Epstein claimed Tartaglione tried to take his life.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: The inmate selected to be Epstein's cellmate after the July incident. He was in court on August 9, 2019, and his removal from the cell left Epstein alone.

persons.name: Lieutenant Rice
persons.context: The Special Housing Unit (SHU) Lieutenant who was repeatedly directed by the Captain to ensure Epstein had a cellmate at all times. He was on leave on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenant Medina
persons.context: The Operations Lieutenant who had oversight of the SHU on August 9, 2019, when Rice was on leave. He was aware Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant Anderson
persons.context: The Lieutenant assigned the 10 PM - 6 AM shift on August 9-10, 2019, who relieved Medina. The Captain believed she was aware Epstein needed a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant Jean
persons.context: The Lieutenant who relieved Anderson early on the morning of August 10, 2019, and called the Captain to report Epstein was found unresponsive without a cellmate.

persons.name: Skipper-Scott
persons.context: The Associate Warden whom the Captain notified after receiving the call from Lieutenant Jean about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bullock
persons.context: The Institution Duty Officer and Chaplain whom the Captain attempted to call for more information after hearing about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Daniels
persons.context: The camera technician who notified the Captain he was working on the SHU camera system earlier in the week. The Captain was not informed the cameras were down.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: A Correctional Officer who, according to Lieutenant Jean, admitted to entering Epstein's cell without supervision on the morning he was found dead.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: A Correctional Officer who, along with Officer Thomas, admitted to failures that were reported to Associate Warden Skipper-Scott.

connections.description: Were cellmates during a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found unresponsive and claimed Tartaglione tried to take his life.
Reyes was selected and housed as Epstein's cellmate after the July incident, following directives from the Warden.
Rice, as SHU Lieutenant, was repeatedly directed by the Captain to ensure Epstein had a cellmate at all times.
Jean reported that Thomas admitted to entering Epstein's cell without supervision, which she then relayed to the Captain.
The Captain reported to the Warden, received directives from him regarding Epstein's housing, and notified him of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, flagged staff. Epstein claimed Tartaglione tried to take his life.

events.title: Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was in court. Reyes's property was removed from the cell, indicating he would not return, leaving Epstein alone contrary to the Warden's directive.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell without a cellmate on the morning of August 10, 2019. Staff admitted to not completing 30-minute rounds, 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM counts.

events.title: FBI/OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: FBI Special Agent Amanda Meyer and OIG Special Agent David Carpenter interviewed the BOP Captain regarding the supervision and circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Epstein engaged in manipulative behavior to avoid having a cellmate, including requesting to see a psychologist and feigning suicidal tendencies.

Despite a clear directive from the Warden that Epstein was to have a cellmate at all times, he was left alone in his cell on the night of August 9-10, 2019, after his cellmate Efrain Reyes went to court and his property was removed.
Critical security protocols failed: 30-minute rounds and inmate counts (3:00 AM and 5:00 AM) were not completed on the night Epstein died, and the surveillance cameras in the SHU were non-functional.
Staff admitted to procedural failures, including Officer Thomas entering Epstein's cell without supervision and officers not completing mandated rounds and counts.
The Captain conveyed the Warden's directive about Epstein's cellmate informally and verbally to his Lieutenants, and did not issue a formal written order or hold a comprehensive meeting.
